Reviews.Title: “Nice Retreat”
Reviews.Author: martha G
Reviews.Content: Over to Visit relatives in London and booked a package without reading up on accomodation. Were we lucky or what.From moment we arrived with a warm welcome , to a lovely clean comfortable room to a busy brisk breakfast room was a treat to stay. We arrived early and so left our luggage for the day.came back from relatives exhausted in the early evening to collect our bags and went our room in the building 4 doors away Hotel 73. Fresh bright room,glorious deep comfortable double bed ,we each had long hot showers and slept 10 hours. Woke up at 6 am starving wandered into Hotel65 and were let in 30 minutes before breakfast was due to start.Plenty of coffee toast,croissants and cereal jam and cheese too.Off out to explore with cousins again. Same again that night to shower and sleep. Next morning went down at 8am and paid for English breakfast -wonderful eggs and smoked bacon with thick pork sausage and beans- delightful and lots of coffee toast yoghurt and cereal too. 7 day stay =perfect,quiet,comfortable,friendly and warm.Will be staying here next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Was meant to be mini break, not Mini Room!”
Reviews.Author: yogarocks19
Reviews.Content: Hotel 65 and annexes is situated in Shepherds Road, Hammersmith, London, so very convienient for Hammersmith Appollo Theatre and reasonably priced for an overnight stay but thats where the plus points end! Our room was in one of the annexes, Hotel 73. Top floor of a converted house. Supposedly a double room, our room was so very very small. No wardrobe just a hanging rail over the bed, the bed filled most of the room and we had a space of about 6' by 3' to move around in although a chest of drawers was placed in this space and once our overnight bags were put there we had a space of about the size of a dining room table to get ready in, so small in fact that my partner had to sit on the bed while I got ready and then we swapped - challenging when you are trying to look glam!!! The bathroom was modern and an ok size but fittings had fallen off the wall and when I turned the shower on the shower head fell on top of me!! also no shelves in the bathroom so all washing gear had to go on the floor or on top of the toilet seat - being top floor and so small it was uncomfortably hot in the room and it was good to get out in the snow later on!! Breakfast was an experience, a very rude and bossy manager barking at the guests who were waiting to be seated and basic food of cold toast and cereal as a reward for this experience! Needless to say we wont be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money in London”
Reviews.Author: zenwoman35
Reviews.Content: After mixed reviews I decided to take a chance and book this hotel anyway. It turned out to be a gem. Hotel 65 has several houses and we were in number 61. Staff were friendly, and efficient. The whole no. 61 house looked recently refurbished and our room was spacious, clean, with a spacious bathroom, tv and free fast wifi (we were at a conference at the nearby 3x more expensive Novotel where Wifi cost 15 GBP per day and didn't work well!). The house was quiet and we felt like we 'lived' in London for the few days we were there. Lots of restaurants and convenience stores within 100 metres of the hotel. Breakfast at no. 65 was in a pleasant room, and a generous continental one, with croissants, as much toast, coffee, tea, chocolate and cereal with yoghurt as you want, and again, friendly and helpful staff. This hotel will be our base next time we are in London.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & cheap”
Reviews.Author: Cas1960
Reviews.Content: We booked via the internet & didn't really know what to expect. I certainly did not like having to carry big heavy suitcases up narrow flights of stairs to our room. Broken fixtures were left in the ensuite. Although I had paid & ordered a full english breakfast, it was just assumed when we went to the dining room that we were just having the continental breakfast! And when I queried it, they seemed offended because we'd already had juice & toast!! However, it was very accessible to Hammersmith tube station which made it easy to go to various places throughout London without too much hassle. And although it was on a busy street very little road noise reached inside the rooms so sleeping was better than we anticipated.

Reviews.Title: “Enough for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Pedro F
Reviews.Content: When I booked a room in Hotel 65 I just wanted a not too expensive place to stay a few days while I was trying to arrange definitive accommodation. The hotel is 7 minutes walking from Hammersmith tube station (served with District and Picadilly lines) making it a perfect place to go anywhere in London. The room was nice with a TV and heating and the staff was friendly. There is free internet as well.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Clean, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BugTheUgly
Reviews.Content: If you just want a cheap place where you can get your head down for the night, then you can't really go wrong. I stayed here for one night when I went to see Switchfoot at the Shepherds Bush Empire (great gig by the way). Checked in at Hotel 65, but they lead me down to Hotel 43 which is a separate building a little down the road. The receptionist gave me directions but then took me down there himself when I looked confused, which was nice of him. The room was off a side entrance to the building which may be a little intimidating for the single female traveller, so worth bearing in mind. Once in the room I was pleasantly surprised. It looked like it had been recently redecorated and everything was fresh and spotlessly clean. There was a double bed even in the single room, with enough room to walk all around the bed, though not too much more to swing the proverbial cat. Plenty enough, though. There was a flat-screen TV with all the usual Freeview channels, some kind of desk, side table and open wardrobe. The bathroom (well, shower room) was equally well presented and actually a good size. The shower was hot and had decent pressure. Even though the hotel is located on a very busy street, the building I was in was set back enough that I couldn't hear a thing (and I live in the countryside so am sensitive to noise). There was the occasional creak from adjoining rooms, but nothing I've not experienced in any other hotel. I can't comment on the breakfast as I had to get out very early. Even at 06:00, though, there was someone on reception to take my room card when I checked out. All-in-all, for the price (and I'd have paid even more with hindsight), I really can't think of a negative at all if all you want is a clean bed for the night.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: becky1198
Reviews.Content: If you want a value priced hotel stay then this is it. Ok it is not 5 star but they do not say they are. I arrived very late with 2 13 year old girls. I was directed to my room which was on the ground floor. But the desgner curtains did not close. I returned to reception and voiced my concerns. The receptionist dealt with it immediately and changed our room. The hotel actually sub lets from neighbouring buildings, and the building was being renovated and we were in a recently renovated room. A little small, but if you are getting away to stay in a hotel room, then go to the ritz! we wanted a pleasant and comfortable base and that is what we got! Newly refurbed bathroom looked lovely and power shower was great. Continental breakfast was great and we were full! There was a working tv to entertain he children before bed time. Only a 10minute walk from hammersmith underground. very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: EssexJacob
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Saturday 19th November 11 . Booked in and was told we'd be staying in the building across the road . We had to climb six flights of stairs to a little attic room .You could here every bit of traffic going past ,the bed was at a slant ,the chair in the room had numerous stains on it .You had to move the toilet seat out of the way to flush the toilet. Got up Sunday morning to have a shower ,only to find there was no water coming out of it & i left it running for a while. I will not be going back .

Reviews.Title: “Group- Success”
Reviews.Author: Kate d
Reviews.Content: Here as assistant to daughters school group leaders.Sitting at checkout time using the free internet terminal- very nice touch and very convenient. Hotel was fine, reception helpful.Rooms were very good for the price(we had 22 rooms)we paid .singles,triples,quads all ensuite and comfortable. Breakfast was brisk(we had 30 minute slot) butthere were4 other groups here at same time German and Danish.Staff served us quick and plenty of food and hot drinks. We had one problem with a Danish group blocking breakfast time by staying past there finish time by over 15 minutes plus they were very noisy in rooms and corridors one evening from 6-11 pm.We complained after 2 hours to reception who were constantly asking the group members to quiten down-in one ear out the otheter for 3 of the students ,the rest did quiten down-were drinking alot though.There group leaders were not to be found anywhere-is in rules that group leader should be around when so many about but they were not and had not left a contact number as they should.The next night no noise once group leaders had been spoken to when they returned. Apart from this everything was fine-surprising considering how busy the hotel was for its size.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever visited”
Reviews.Author: Nina2929
Reviews.Content: The stay at Hotel 65 was an appalling experience. We came there with a group of youth who had earned and saved money, planned and looked forward to the London trip for two years. As a group, we were from the first second met with severe unfriendliness by the hotel staff, accompanied by a set of specific hotel-defined rules which gave associations to reformative 19 th century schools - which included the information that if soembody breaks one of these unbelievable rules, the hotel has the right to fine you. And a demand for 300 pounds deposit. The hotel had been booked on the background of their internet- presentation, and their information to the agency. Onthis bakcground we had booked and prepaid the hotel stay for the whole group. Of course, the information did not tell about the unfirendliness, the insects and unclealiness, or the hotel rules. Neither did it tell that the hotel staff will treat you as an outcast if you ask a question (Can we have breakfast at 08.30 tomorrow instead of your suggested 07.30?), or make a complaint (There are spiders in our room). Let me also tell that the youth behaved very well, and gave the hotel director no reason to fine them. They all felt unwanted by hotel staff, and insecure, and that the athmosphere very unpleasant. I have travelled a lot, to countries all over the world, with groups, and with friends and family. Stayed in everything from 1 star to 5 star hotels. I have never experienced anything like the unpleasant athmosphere at this hotel. I would hope that no other groups of youth will be exposed to this kind of treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Location excellent,service great”
Reviews.Author: peter w
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with work colleagues for 5 days ,were spread over 3 buildings as on website-all rooms were clean and ok,pretty clean bathrooms ,all you need amenities expected in 2 star hotel.Rooms not large but ok- you are in London after all. Better than other hotels stayed in with company in Newcastle and Leeds especially,Holland for the price this is value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location not so good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mozhan
Reviews.Content: First the good ones. The location is great, about 7-8 mins walk 7-8 mins underground total of 15 mins to city center (eg. Piccadilly Circus, Hyd Park, etc). With 7-8 mins walking distance is a great Westfield Mall with all the top notch designer names such as Gucci, Louis Vuitton, Burberry, Dior, Prada and many more. But then why would you stay if at such a hotel if you can shop these stores? Continental breakfast was fine with toasted bread, jellies and cereals. The rooms, however, were awful. A triple room was only 10x12 feet at most. The bathroom (they call it ensuite) is 3x6 including the shower (serious, no kidding). Sheets and towels were clean but the beds and the carpet were badly worn and old with tears here and there. The two chairs were so dirty that we did not dare sit on them. 13 inch TV remote was broken and there were only 3 channels tuned. The wall paint had cracks all over. When I asked for a possibility to change the room I was told that "this was one of the better rooms" they had. I think that no average passenger would ever want to stay in such a hotel unless as a last resort.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible! Be warned of this place.”
Reviews.Author: 10Haageh
Reviews.Content: Frightening manager, unfriendly staff. This place is definitely for the bravest. Just home from London after 4 nights there with a group of 20 students (age 15) and 4 adults. Alltogether vi had 8 rooms. Some of the rooms were acceptable, others full of insects and stinking mold. There is no internet as promised. One of the rooms upstairs had a shower leaking steaming water 24 hrs., resulting in uninhabitable conditions, hot and damp, water drippng fram the ceiling. Was promised repaired every day during our stay. Worst of all is the absolutely disgusting behaviour fram the manager. On arrival we were presented with two pages of rules to follow, to avoid being fined 20 - 60 Â£ for each "offense". The manager also bragging about how he at occasions had lurked in the dark to catch "offenders". We were demanded a deposit of 300Â£, which we denied, then all our passports were accepted as a minimum deposit. Breakfast, toast with jam and cheese, were served at the 30 minutes desided by management, usually at 0730-0800. One student 15 minutes late one day, resulted in loud reprimands in the breakfastroom. During our stay the breakfastroom was never full. Our comments to this boot camp disipline resulted in a very threatening behaviour on behalf of the manager, calling our comments "rubbish", and "If you do not like the rules her, you can leave". Myself being a professional serviceperson in charge of several cafees and restaurants, I was profoundly chocked by this persons way of treating his guests. "More scaring than London Dungeon", according to one of our students. After scrutinizing inspection of our rooms, we were finally handed our passports, delaying the bus 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Claireyy
Reviews.Content: I was worried reading some of these reviews! Stayed here for one night initially and booked a second night thereafter. We stayed in building 61, out with main hotel building. Rooms look like they've just been renovated, with ensuites and hairdryer/ flat screen tv. Basic, clean and comfortable. Continental breakfast and wifi included in price. Roughly 5-10 min walk to either goldhawk rd tube or shepherds bush tube. Staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Corretje71
Reviews.Content: When you go to London to see the city center and just need a hotel to sleep, you can hit the Hotel 65 without any problem. The room we got was very small, but clean. The mattresses were not that nice, but I could sleep on it. The staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was from 7 to 9 am and consisted of 3 toasts, a cup of coffee/tea and some juice. There was some butter, cheese and jam. Hotel 65 has several buildings in the area and we slept at number 61, room 1a. A newly built, or renovated hotelroom and the main entrance of this building was not finished yet. Overall it was a good stay for the money. We stayed here for 4 nights and really enjoyed London!! We should book this hotel again for a citytrip to London. From hotel to Hammersmith station was about 8 minutes walking, and to Shepard's Bush station about 6 minutes, I guess. And there is a busstop in front of the hotel if you need it.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T BE FOOLED BY SOUTH KENSINGTON!!!”
Reviews.Author: campbellina87
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at this hotel. Firstly it's address says South Kengsington.. we were almost laughed out of the taxi when we asked for this hotel there!! Nowhere near the place, used purely as a selling point. You are actually in Hammersmith, and a 10minute walk from the tube station at that. Our welcome was OK. A friendly receptionist. The group infront of us tho were actually directed to hotels dotted about across the road!! These are obviously the annexes but I wasn't expecting them to be in different locations entirely. We were 'lucky' enough to be based in the main hotel. Our room was frankly, gross! The bed was so so uncomfortable and the bathroom comes with no toiletries with the exception of a USED bar of soap on the sink!! Ew! The maid made up our bed with our clothes still inside it! Haha. And when I asked for an iron from reception, I had to take it back to the room and iron it on the bed as there was no facilities to do it. We missed breakfast, once because we got the time wrong, the other because the queue was so big! On a whole, we probably got what we payed for, but the room was just incredibly unpleasant and we couldn't wait to get out of there. The TV had no remote, and it was absolutley freezing in there too, with no way of changing it! Would NOT reccomend it to anyone! Spend Â£20 quid more and stay somewhere abit nicer. Usually I would feel mean saying this about a small hotel, but the owner was quite pompous too, so take your hard earned cash elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “It's my favourite place to stay when I come to London!”
Reviews.Author: peterwalters
Reviews.Content: For the last 15 years i've been using Hotel 65 as my home away from home, I come every few months and stay for about a week for work. I was quiet surprised by some of the recent reviews so felt I needed to leave my own. Hotel 65 is not some 5 star hotel but its by no means a dump in some slum, its a hotel that offers a great service at a great price. I've stayed in probably all the rooms in all the buildings at some point or another and its what you'd expect from a good 2 star hotel, its clean with tea/coffee etc and in a great location. They are currently doing some renovations inside and out so there is some building materials around but this will only improve the hotel when its done. Basically if your expecting 'The Dorchestor' dont bother booking but if you looking for a clean, cheap and friendly place Hotel 65 is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “For the brave”
Reviews.Author: Will de d
Reviews.Content: Hotel 65 is really a hotel for the brave. Small rooms with worn out bumpy mattress where sleep is impossible. Almost every piece of furniture in the room is broken and my televison was not working. The bathroom contained bodyhair of the people who have stayed before and the sheets were dirty and full of stains. And if you try to report anything, you will find an completely uninterested staff. And don't forget the pleasure of finding sacks of rubish in front of the main entrance and the vermin everywhere. Hotel 65 is also far away from Central London. If you are interested in a survival trip, you can stay here. If your stomach can take the breakfast and your body the poor hygiene in this guesthouse, you are also ready for a trip to India. If you want to enjoy a good nights sleep, don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel but ok”
Reviews.Author: jok
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night with work colleagues. We paid Â£50 per night for an ensuite room with breakfast which has to be great value. We were across the road from reception in another building. The rooms were ok, nothing special but they were clean if a litlle cold,noisy and tired. There is a kettle with tea and coffee, a hairdryer and TV in the room and the bathroom ( v small) was clean with a nice hot shower. Breakfast was fast and basic. For a no frills, budget stay, this ticks the box. I'd recommend the Italian restaurant 2 doors down from the main Hotel 65 building- we had a lovely 3 course set meal for Â£15.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value for money, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kitty343
Reviews.Content: Me and my daughter had come to London for some last min Christmas shopping so needed somewhere which was in a good location but great value for money. Hotel 65 fit the bill, the staff were friendly and very helpfull, the hotel was clean and we were right round the corner from some great shopping! We had a great stay and will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Stay well away”
Reviews.Author: stevie123321
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 3 times, not by choice but rather by employers choice. Although every year i complain about the accomodation at Hotel 65 it gets me no where with my employers. Let me stay with my most recent trip in 2010. Where do i start? The rooms are very cramped, very small. I stayed in a room for three people and this was definately too small. The bathroom provided are so small that it is possible to go to the toilet, wash your hands in the sink and wash your feet in the shower at the same time. Hardly adequate for anyone, let alone a group of very active sports people such as my team. The staff are horrible, as we have stayed there 2 previous years, the staff knew us, and warned us that we are not allowed to enjoy alcholic beverages in our room. To me this is a disgrace, if after a hard days work we wish to enjoy some alchol it should be alright to do so, furthur more the staff had the cheek to accuse us of taking and dealing in prohibited substances, which was simply untrue. The thing that takes the biscuit is the vermon that live in the hotel. A member of our team has servere skin issues and we discovered that the beds were riddled with bed bugs as they came out in large red blotches that were tested and caused by sleeping in the bed. A member of our team spotted a rat scurry along a hallway whilst on her phone to her boyfriend, and furthur evidence of a rat was presented when a member of our team wanted to get a shower. He went to get his show gel from his bag, when he lifted a bag of chocolate rasins out to discover a small hole in the bottom of the bag as the sweets fell out. On furthur inspection we noticed the bag was bitten open by vermon. The same team member then lifted out a t shirt he had to discover rat urine and poo all over the t shirt. This was an utter disgrace and forced our team and i out of the hotel. When we confronted the rude staff member who convenently couldnt speak english until we mentioned ringing the police blamed us for the infestation and that we were using illegal substances. We therefore invited him to ring the police to search us for such substances. Our team is a sports teams where substance use is totally out of line. Therefore it is proposterous to suggest that we would use such things. We took alot of pictures of the hotel and found rat bait boxes under beds and other evidence of rats. With this we informed environmental services who confirmed that there was a serious infestation within hotel 45 which is operated by hotel 65 and other properties where to be investigated. I would seriously tell anyone who would consider staying in this Hotel to just forget it unless they want to come away sick and insulted. I would not let a dog stay in these premisis let alone a person. I hope you find this useful. Please consider other hotels when staying in london because london is such a fantastic place that does not to be ruined by you stay in a dangerous grotty hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad by London standards”
Reviews.Author: SweetHeartScene
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in hotels all over London; some budget and some luxury. This is definitely budget! That's not neccersarily a bad thing but if you're booking here you need to be aware of that. Location : We were staying there for a gig at the Hammersmith Apollo and for that it was perfect! A five minute walk away which was fantastic. It is within walking distance of three tube stations and also of Westfield mall. There are plenty of shops and food places around and the area from what we saw was fairly nice. Rooms : We had a triple room and unfortunately we were at the front of the building so the sound of street traffic was able to be heard inside the room. The room had a lot of electricity outlets which we were pleased with and a small television. The room on the whole was clean but there was a left over french fry in the bathroom. The rooms are old with paint peeling but as I wasn't living there this didn't bother me. Staff : I only encountered one staff member while there and he was nice enough. Benefits : They do have free wifi! You have to ask for the password but our room had a fairly strong signal. We had breakfast included in our rate and we were a little too tender to go down for it but it smelt nice at least! For the price I would say this place is pretty good. I would stay here again and recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good value accomodation, if you are looking for no frills”
Reviews.Author: saraBelfast
Reviews.Content: The hotel is split across a number of buildings in the area. We stayed in a basement room at no 69, and paid Â£65 for B&B. The hotel is well located, near the underground and bus routes. Our room was basic and smelt musty, but if you are looking for somewhere cheap to sleep in central london for one or two nights then this is a good choice. This is a no frills hotel, and I would not recommend if you like lots of TV channels, luxurious bathrooms, room service, etc. We did not get up in time for breakfast (finished serving at 9am). Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean Tidy Full of Frendly staff Would be first hotel i would g to if i was back in london :D”
Reviews.Author: BenBryceclason
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great hotel to stay in .Will Definently be back terrific value and great service.Would recomend hs to any1 staying in london

Reviews.Title: “You need some luck”
Reviews.Author: L0nneke
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a large group. Half of the group was not amused at all, the other half I didn't hear. I shared the room with somebody else and we thought it wasn't so bad. Rooms are small and simple. Our room was clean, but we heart some bad news of the others. Our douche was working, so there we were lucky too. Breakfast was very early (7.30) and we were 10 minutes late. This was not appreciated by the staff. But my colleague had a little chat with the lady who helped in the room and than she offered us eggs. So the "breakfast" staff was nice. The lady in the reception was really unfriendly, haven't seen here smiling during our stay. The area is very nice and handy, but the hotel I wouldn't recommend. Too much risk for a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: clodej
Reviews.Content: Good value, comfortable room,great hot shower and incredibly clean bathroom Great breakfast. All you can want in a hotel with easy direct acces to central London.

Reviews.Title: “Shephard nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Jeltsje
Reviews.Content: I want to warn everyone who considers staying in Hotel 65. Hotel 65 is definitely the place to be, if you want a hotel with a rude staff, enjoy broken furniture, and feel home at a place where dirt doesn't only cover the floor, but almost is the only substance of the floor, blankets an curtains. Test your survival skills; if you survive this hotel, you know you'll be able to stay anywhere. We rented a room in Hotel 65, knowing that it was a hotel in the cheaper section. We were promised something basic and small but clean in an agreeable neighbourhood. However, the place was awefully dirty, a lot of the furniture was broken, and we didn't dare to go to the shops across the street alone, because after 9 o'clock they were the popular hangout for alcoholics. So do avoid this place, unless you don't mind to roughen things up a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Normal hotel, good price”
Reviews.Author: DuFFi_SK
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of its good price and location. It is approximately 10-15 minutes walking from the metro station (Hammersmith). The room was clean, without noise and it was in the next building. We also had continental breakfast included in price (one toast with cheese and juice). The only problem was with our room key which was not working, but the receptionist helped us :)

Reviews.Title: “Once BITTEN, twice shy!”
Reviews.Author: airsmiles
Reviews.Content: I have avoided writing a review of my harrowing visit to Hotel 65, but the fact I am still paying the price for this visit has left me with no choice but to warn others. I wasn't keen on staying here as I believe in comfort over budget but our friends booked it and of course, the price seemed reasonable. The hotel is all you'd expect for its price range: cramped, poorly furnished and basic. What I hadn't expected was the following: HORROR NUMBER 1: My partner found a white plastic contraption under the bed with "Pest control" written on it. Clearly the hotel expected "visitors" in our room. It seems they weren't wrong... HORROR NUMBER 2: I woke, went to the shower room and discovered to my horror that I had a large number of red bites all over on my stomach. You will know what these were without me spelling it out. Three weeks on and the bites have not gone away. Only antihistamines will make them go down and they are now scarring. Please, I really do recommend you keep well away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the faint hearted”
Reviews.Author: Drovers-Girl
Reviews.Content: Cheap in London terms but still expensive for what it was. Good location with lots of restaurants nearby and some good pubs including an excellent one at Brook Green. Now the hotel.... there were plastic sheets on the bed (cringe) and a very worn bedspread. The room had a musty smell as though someone old had lived there for a long time and had been forgotten about and the bathroom was really a toilet and shower enclosed in a cupboard. The TV was as small as a postage stamp and the reception was fine if you wanted to watch snow falling. All in all, the room is a shock but okay for a night. Breakfast was choatic but very good with great service and this was probably the best bit of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Lizzie71NorthWest
Reviews.Content: Yes, the room was small, especially the bathroom. Yes, the breakfast was pretty basic. Yes, we had to boil the kettle on the floor because the lead wasn't long enough to reach the socket. But at that price, in London, what do you expect? The room was clean and comfortable, the water was hot, the breakfast was plentiful. As a base for shopping/sightseeing, it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: rockintravel77
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel 65 for three days in September. The location of the hotel is very good, 10-15 minutes walk from Hammersmith station, and the neighborhood is nice and "un-touristy" with shops and restaurants. I had a single room at the New Century Inn. The room was pretty small but with a comfortable, queen-size bed. As quoted by other guests, there is a problem with the hot water. On the first day, I couldn't get any; on the second, I complained to reception who told me the guest in the room next to mine had used up all the hot water, which I didn't really believe. The receptionist came with me to the room, and it turned out you have to leave the water running for about 10 minutes to get it hot. However, in general the room was clean and adequate, if not a three-star standard (no phone, TV working on only a few channels, no desk and only one chair). I was surprised to learn the hotel charges an extra 5 GBP for an "English breakfast" (and a very skimpy one by my standards), even though my reservation included a full English breakfast. The breakfast staff were incredibly hectic, banging plates and spilling juice. The standard Continental breakfast is only toast, jam, cheese and cereals. I might stay here again, but it's certainly not a favourite place.

Reviews.Title: “A NIGHTMARE”
Reviews.Author: teacherlodosa
Reviews.Content: We were at this hotel on a school trip ( with students aged 15-16 from LODOSA, Spain) and had a really bad experience. The man who had the night shift was really rude to us and insulted our students, who are really well behaved and good mannered, calling them " stupid idiots". The place was really dirty, no cleanliness in the rooms, and with broken items of furniture. The only thing the manager wanted was the 150 pounds deposit we were obliged to give him on the day of our arrival. So, he accused us of smoking in the rooms and breaking the furniture. He is a liar! We couldn't congregate in the street after 10 p.m! If we did so or made any noise, we were fined with 20 pounds each. Something incredible. Our students were really afraid and didn't dare go out of their bedrooms, in case that terrible man appeared. They donÂ´t deserve it, IÂ´m sorry for them. I wouldnÂ´t recommend this hotel to anyone. I must say that we asked the police in Hammersmith for help and they were really helpful and kind to us. This didn't seem to be new for them, I think it was not the first time they received a complaint from this hotel. My best regards to the nice students from Pablo Sarasate High School in Lodosa, who showed respect and patience towards the complicated situation they had to go through.

Reviews.Title: “Ok overall, but just for short stays”
Reviews.Author: Frandrake
Reviews.Content: I was in London from 4 nights travelling alone and I booked a single ensuite room at Hotel 65. Once there I was told that the hotels are in fact 6, and I was sent to Hotel 45, 100m down the same road of Hotel 65. The room was extremely small, the smallest room I've ever been into. The "bathroom" was even worse, washing in the shower was a pain as I hit the walls every time I tried to move. A good thing about the hotel is that it's clean (for UK standards), even if it had not a very nice smell. Another good thing is that the hotel is 10-15 min walk from Hammersmith underground station, which will take you to the center of London in 20-30 minutes. Overall is a good hotel for a very short stay and just for having a place where to sleep, I do not recommend it to people who want to spend more time at the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great value and service”
Reviews.Author: anneyBirmingham
Reviews.Content: 10 of us booked individually without telling hotel we were connected ,on the second day they rearranged our rooms so we could be in the same building.Lucky we told them first evening as they were full the next day ,we had a long Easter Weekend. Comfortable clean rooms ,very clean bathrooms and great breakfast. Friendly staff and very good value -what more could you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “OK location, bit scummy”
Reviews.Author: MyReview22
Reviews.Content: A party of 6 of us checked into Hotel 65 only to be told our rooms were actually 200 yards away in another building. Hotel rooms were teeny tiny, with pretty gross decor. Although at first glace it didn't look clean, I was happily surprised with the white crisp bed sheets. We ALL had cold showers, again the bathrooms were very very small, one person has to pivot their way around it. Breakfasts were not 'full' or 'English' instead some toast and plastic cheese were all we were offered. Yes it was cheap (only my London standards) but I still feel we could have received more for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Never believe internet photos!”
Reviews.Author: chemist62
Reviews.Content: When I arrived there, the guy at the reception desk with a weird accent told me that my room was at another building, trying to convince me that that room was better!? It was just a nightmare, room was at the top floor(former attic) with an open window almost at the ceiling, broken, and I couldn't sleep because of cold air and drunk people's songs filling in the room al nite long.And there was no hot water at all!! Next morning I stopped at the reception, there was another guy who knows from which country, didn't like my complaints, almost yelled at me but said he'd check the room. That afternoon nothing was fixed and I wanted to leave the hotel. New receptionist, young woman from Bulgaria, offered me another room at the main building, which was awful but at least window was not broken! Then she showed me the toilet?! which was at the corridor not in the room! It was the worst hotel ever, do not go there if you have any respect for yourself! I didn't have any other chance at that time so I had to stay but NEVER AGAIN IN THIS WORLD!!!!!! By the way what kind of a country is that?..How come this hotel is still in business???????????Shame on you ENGLAND!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Well Located Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ArmaghWanderers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 3 night break in November as a couple. Weather was pretty poor (wet & cold) but it is the UK in winter. The room was quite small with 3 single beds. Pull back the covers to reveal spotlessly clean white sheets. The bathroom was also very clean. Location was excellent with 3 tube stops within 10mins walk from the hotel. No lifts in the hotel but it is not a tall affair. We stayed on a Bed and full English breakfast basis. The breakfast consisted of coffee/tea, toast, 2 bacon, 1 egg, 1 sausage with tomatoes or beans. All were well cooked and very tasty. Staff were also friendly and effeicent. To sum up if you are travelling on a budget and want a clean, well located hotel look no further. We will use this hotel again and could recommend it to others who want no frills accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: canary2211
Reviews.Content: Clean, cheap, great value for London. Nothing spectacular - but at GBP45 for a single room with cooked breakfast it is absolutley fine. Spotless, warm quiet room, spotless bathroom (if cramped). Adequately comfortable bed. OK, so you walk 20m down the road to the next building - well so what? Many hotels you wlak much further! One or two revieiwers below may have got unlucky_ others are perhaps looking for something more than a basic clean B&B for a nights or tow. The hotel seemed to have a lot of young tourists into the UK. Would I stay again? Certainly if I needed to be in that part of London. Would I take my wife/family - yes I would at that price.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth53
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a bit of a joke really. Although London-Discount-Hotel.com had sent through our booking for two single rooms, Hotel 65 had no record of it. The Romainian on the night reception was helpful -we were first shown two single rooms at the front of 65.They were very small and very noisy. The radiators could be be adjusted so the room was very hot. When I complained my daughter was given a better room up the road. It was not a full breakfast as I had been led to believe and there was no choice at all-white bread toast and cheese. The breakfast staff were friendly enough but rushed because breakfast had started at 7pm until 9pm on a Sunday! So everyone came down at 8.50am. My final thoughts were that this owner is simply in it for the money and is not at all interested in improving his properties or in customer service.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel 65
HotelInfo.Address: 65 Shepherds Bush Road, London W6 7LS, England
